titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Georges Lauweryns Manuscript and Printed music
titlestmt.author: by Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 06:58

did.unittitle: Georges Lauweryns manuscript and printed music

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Georges Lauweryns Manuscript and Printed Music consists of manuscript and printed music composed by Lauweryns, and printed music of other composers owned by Lauweryns. Most music by Lauweryns consists of songs for voice and piano or voice and orchestra. Also present are piano, chamber, orchestral, and ballet music. Manuscript music by Lauweryns is in several hands, including those of copyists and possibly the composer's autograph. Some manuscripts include performance annotations or printer's markings. Many bear stamps of the Société des auteurs, compositeurs et éditeurs de musique, or are accompanied by registration forms for the Société. Music by other composers consists of songs for voice and piano by Jules Massenet, and solo piano music, orchestral works, and operas in vocal score by several early 20th-century composers, many inscribed by the composer to Lauweryns.

langmaterial.language: Most vocal music is in French.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Georges Lauweryns Manuscript and Printed Music is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Georges Lauweryns Manuscript and Printed Music. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was formerly classed as Uncat Mss 328 and Uncat Mss 477. In 2005, the collection received a preliminary level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. A preliminary finding aid was compiled from lists created at the time of receipt by the Library. Folder titles were based on information provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles were not verified against contents of folders. This preliminary list was migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of of thel list; however, the content was neither modified nor verified.

In 2012, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including rehousing and reorganization. The collection was reclassed, folder titles were revised, folder contents were verified, and containers were renumbered.

bioghist.head: Georges Lauweryns
bioghist.p: Georges Lauweryns, conductor, pianist, and composer. Lauweryns conducted at the Théâtre royal de la Monnaie, Brussels, and for operas and concerts in Paris and Monte Carlo. His brother Fernand Lauweryns was a music publisher in Brussels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Georges Lauweryns Manuscript and Printed Music consists of manuscript and printed music composed by Lauweryns, and printed music by others owned by Lauweryns. Most music by Lauweryns consists of songs for voice and piano or works for voice and orchestra. Also present are piano, chamber, orchestral, and ballet music. Manuscript music by Lauweryns is in several hands, including copyists and possibly the composer's autograph. Some manuscripts include performance annotations or printer's markings. Many bear stamps of the Société des auteurs, compositeurs et éditeurs de musique, or are accompanied by registration forms for the Société. Music by other composers consists of songs for voice and piano by Jules Massenet, and solo piano music, orchestral works, and operas in vocal score by several early 20th-century composers, many inscribed by the composer to Lauweryns.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Music by Georges Lauweryns, 1899-1938. II. Music by Others, 1899-1946.

controlaccess.corpname: Société des auteurs, compositeurs et éditeurs de musique (France)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some manuscripts include draft fragments of unidentified works. Some dates are from stamps or accompanying registration forms of the Société des auteurs, compositeurs et éditeurs de musique. Uniform titles have not been determined. Contents of sets of parts have not been verified.

did.unittitle: Massenet, Jules. Songs for voice and piano

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed scores:
L'âme des fleurs . Version in C major. (Paris: Quinzard, undated).
C'est l'amour . Version for contralto. (Paris: Heugel, c1908).
Expressions lyriques. En voyage . Version for soprano. (Paris: Heugel, 1913).
La gavotte de Puyjoli . Version for one voice. (Paris: Heugel, undated).
La lettre . Version in F major. (Paris: Heugel, c1907).
Les mains . Version for soprano. (Paris: Heugel, c1899).
Mélodies. Avril est amoureux . 2 versions: mezzo soprano or baritone; tenor (Paris: Heugel, c1900).
[Mélodies]. Éveil . Verison for mezzo soprano or baritone. (Paris: Heugel, c1906).
[Mélodies]. La vie d'une rose . (Paris: Girod, undated).
Oh! Si les fleurs ayient des yeux . 3 versions: mezzo soprano or baritone; soprano; tenor. (Paris: Heugel, c1903).
Les oiselets . Verison for mezzo soprano or baritone. (Paris: Hartmann, undated).
Rondel de la belle au bois . (Paris: Heugel, c1900)
Sérénade du passant . Verison for mezzo soprano or baritone. (Paris: Hartmann, undated).
Si vous vouliez bien me le dire . Version for baritone. (Paris: Heugel, c1907).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
